caseName: Fay v. Chicago, St. Paul, Minneapolis & Omaha Railway Co.
caseNameFull: BRIDGET FAY v. CHICAGO, ST. PAUL, MINNEAPOLIS & OMAHA RAILWAY COMPANY

opinions.snippet:
MITOI-IELL, J.
This was an action to recover damages for the death of plaintiff’s intestate, caused by the alleged negligence of the defendant. When the plaintiff rested, the court, on motion of the defendant, *193dismissed the case, on the ground that the plaintiff had failed to establish a cause of action. From an order denying a new trial, the plaintiff appealed.</
